dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.log.tip.nrf.SubNetworkConnection
dataStructure.description:
This object class represents the relationship between Termination Points. All end point TPs related by an Subnetwork Connection (SNC) must support the same or an equivalent layer rate which is also the SNC's layer rate. In pending state, generic Connection Termination Point(s) of the SNC could be replied. Refer to the associated supporting document SD1-36_SNCTypes for explanation of SNC Properties, SNC Parameters, unidirectional SNCs, Point-to-Multipoint SNC, Routing Constraints and Route Discovery. See R_TMF518_NRF_I_0024 and R_TMF518_NRF_I_0025. For bundled SNCs see R_TMF518_NRF_I_0032.

This entity is optional

This entity is extendable

This entity generates Object Creation notifications

This entity generates Object Deletion notifications

This entity generates Object Discovery notifications

This entity generates Attribute Value Change notifications.
dataStructure.label: SubNetworkConnection

child.name: direction
child.description:
This attribute identifies the directionality of the SNC.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: direction

child.name: staticProtectionLevel
child.description:
This attribute indicates the degree of internal resilience/protection of the SNC.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: staticProtectionLevel

child.name: aEndTpDataList
child.description:
This attribute lists all A End TP names together with their TP data (TP Mapping Mode, Transmission Parameters).

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: aEndTpDataList

child.name: zEndTpDataList
child.description:
This attribute lists all Z End TP names together with their TP data (TP Mapping Mode, Transmission Parameters).

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: zEndTpDataList

child.name: isBundledSnc
child.description:
This attribute indicates if the SNC is a bundled SNC.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: isBundledSnc

child.name: routeGroupLabel
child.description:
This attribute represents the Route Group the Subnetwork Connection is associated to. When a target OS creates a Call with diverse Route Groups, it assigns a Route Group label (which may be a number) to each SNC. SNCs in the same Route Group will be assigned the same value for routeGroupLabel. SNCs in different Route Groups will be assigned different values for routeGroupLabel.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: routeGroupLabel

child.name: aEndPointsRole
child.description:
This attribute indicates the end point role of the aEndTPs of the SNC. At a connection matrix (CM) end point the span of the SNC starts at a G.805 CP with a fixed or flexible connection through the ME at the SNC layer, i.e. the connectable layer of the end point. At a link connection (LC) end point connectivity is adapted from a server layer and the span of the SNC starts with a G.805 TCP. See R_TMF518_NRF_I_0026.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: aEndPointsRole

child.name: isFixed
child.description:
This attribute identifies if the SubnetworkConnection is fixed (i.e. cannot be deleted by the requestig OS). A fixed SNC is defined a SNC whose all cross connects are fixed.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: isFixed

child.name: correlationIdentifier
child.description:
This attribute contains information about relationships that this subnetwork connection may have to other objects. Changes in the value of this attribute lead to an AVC notification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: correlationIdentifier

child.name: ituArcStateAndStatusList
child.description:
See R_TMF518_NRB_I_0001 and R_TMF518_NRB_I_0004. See supporting document SD1-8_encodingX731M3100

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: ituArcStateAndStatusList

child.name: isReportingAlarms
child.description:
This attribute identifies whether alarm reporting for this subnetwork connection is administratively activated or de-activated. Changes in the value of this attribute lead to an AVC notification. True = alarm reporting is activated; False = alarm reporting is de-activated.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: isReportingAlarms

child.name: networkReroute
child.description:
This attribute indicates if the reroute (if allowed) should be computed by the network (YES), by the EMS (NO), or if it does not matter (NOT_SET). Changes in the value of this attribute lead to an AVC notification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: networkReroute

child.name: state
child.description:
This attribute identifies the SNC connection state. See R_TMF518_NRF_I_0028.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: state

child.name: mustRetainOldSnc
child.description:
This attribute identifies if an original route of the SNC is maintained and that it is possible to swap back this route. Changes in the value of this attribute lead to an AVC notification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: mustRetainOldSnc

child.name: mustRemoveGtps
child.description:
This attribute defines that the target OS has to delete all the interior GTPs supporting the bundled SNC when the SNC is deleted. It is only used for bundled SNCs. It can take on two possible values: - TRUE (the target OS must make a best-effort attempt to remove the interior GTPs that once belonged to the SNC) and - FALSE (the requesting OS doesn't care if the target OS removes the interior GTPs or not). In the case that mustRemoveGTPs is set to "TRUE" and the target OS cannot remove all the interior GTPs, the target OS should return a list of the GTPs that could not be removed in the errorReason field of the deactivateAndDeleteSNC and deleteSNC operations. The errorReason will be "not all interior GTPs could be deleted" - this will be followed by the names of the GTPs that could not be deleted.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: mustRemoveGtps

child.name: layerRate
child.description:
This attribute identifies the layer rate of the SNC. It is specified by the requesting OS upon object creation. Note: In case of a bundled SNC the value LR_Not_Applicable is used. The requesting OS can determine the layer rate by looking at the CTPs contained in the aEnd and zEnd GTPs.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is invariant

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: layerRate

child.name: type
child.description:
This attribute indicates the external traffic flow through the SNC. See R_TMF518_NRF_I_0029.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: type

child.name: networkRouted
child.description:
This attribute specifies if the route for this SNC is computed by the network. If rerouting is allowed, this attribute tells who last rerouted the SNC, the network (YES) or the EMS (NO).

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: networkRouted

child.name: revertive
child.description:
This attribute defines if the SNC can be switched back to its original (intended) route. In case the SNC is "revertive" (True), the restoration process will always switch to the intended route if possible, i.e. if there are no failures or if the intended route is not locked. Changes in the value of this attribute lead to an AVC notification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: revertive

child.name: priority
child.description:
This attribute identifies the priority of the SNC. Allowed values are = "0" , "1" , "2" , ... where zero (0) is the highest priority. Changes in the value of this attribute lead to an AVC notification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: priority

child.name: zEndPointsRole
child.description:
This attribute indicates the end point role of the zEndTPs of the SNC. At a connection matrix (CM) end point the span of the SNC starts at a G.805 CP with a fixed or flexible connection through the ME at the SNC layer, i.e. the connectable layer of the end point. At a link connection (LC) end point connectivity is adapted from a server layer and the span of the SNC starts with a G.805 TCP. See R_TMF518_NRF_I_0026.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: zEndPointsRole

child.name: rerouteAllowed
child.description:
This attribute specifies if the target OS/MEs are allowed and/or required to reroute this SNC if there is a failure on this SNC, periodically to optimize the routes, of for any other reason. It is an target OS/ME implementation whether this is done using network routing protocols or if the target OS/MEs detect the failure and take appropriate action to attempt to fix the SNC. The NO value means that the target OS/MEs are not allowed to reroute the SNC. The YES value means that the target OS/MEs are allowed to reroute the SNC and are required to attempt to reroute it upon failure. The NA value is used when the requesting OS does not want to specify the exact target OS behaviour. In this case it is left up to the target OS to decide whether rerouting will be provided. It is also used if the target OS/MEs are allowed to reroute the SNC but not required to attempt to reroute it upon failure.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC disabled
child.label: rerouteAllowed

child.name: zEndTpList
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..*

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association SncHasZEndGtps

This association end is optional
child.label: zEndTpList

child.name: route
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association SncIsCharacterisedByRoutes

This association end is optional
child.label: route

child.name: asapRef
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association SubNetworkConnectionHas

This association end is optional
child.label: asapRef
